text: During the time of the judges, there was a famine in the land of Judah. So a man from Bethlehem in Judah went to live as a resident foreigner in the region of Moab, along with his wife and two sons.

(Now the <st data-num="0376" class="">man’s</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">name</st> was <st data-num="0458" class="">Elimelech</st>,<n id="1" /> his <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> was <st data-num="05281" class="">Naomi</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="08034" class="">and</st> his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> were <st data-num="04248" class="">Mahlon</st> and <st data-num="03630" class="">Kilion</st>.<n id="3" /> They were <st data-num="0673">of the clan of Ephrath</st><n id="4" /> from <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st> in <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>.) They <st data-num="0935" class="">entered</st> the <st data-num="07704" class="">region</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st> and <st data-num="01961" class="">settled</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.<n id="5" />

Sometime later<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05281" class="">Naomi’s</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st> <st data-num="0458" class="">Elimelech</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>, so <st data-num="01931" class="">she</st> and her <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="07604">were left</st> alone.

Both her sons<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05375" class="">married</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="04125" class="">Moabite</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">women.<sup></sup></st> (<st data-num="0259" class="">One</st> was <st data-num="08034" class="">named</st> <st data-num="06204" class="">Orpah</st> <st data-num="08034">and</st> the <st data-num="08145" class="">other</st> <st data-num="07327" class="">Ruth</st>.)<n id="3" /> And they <st data-num="03427" class="">continued to live</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> about <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>.

Then Naomi’s <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> sons, <st data-num="04248" class="">Mahlon</st> and <st data-num="03630" class="">Kilion</st>, <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>.<n id="1" /> So the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="07604" class="">was left</st> all alone—bereaved of her <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03206" class="">children</st><n id="2" /> as well as her <st data-num="0376" class="">husband</st>!

So she decided to return home from the region of Moab, accompanied by her daughters-in-law, because while she was living in Moab she had heard that the Lord had shown concern for his people, reversing the famine by providing abundant crops.
Now as she and her two daughters-in-law began to leave the place where she had been living to return to the land of Judah,

Naomi said to her two daughters-in-law, “Listen to me! Each of you should return to your mother’s home. May the Lord show you the same kind of devotion that you have shown to your deceased husbands and to me.
May the Lord enable each of you to find security in the home of a new husband.” Then she kissed them goodbye, and they wept loudly.
But they said to her, “No! We will return with you to your people.”
But Naomi replied, “Go back home, my daughters! There is no reason for you to return to Judah with me. I am no longer capable of giving birth to sons who might become your husbands!

<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">back</st> home, my <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st>! <st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> I <st data-num="02204" class="">am</st> too <st data-num="02204" class="">old</st> to <st data-num="01961" class="">get</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">married</st> again.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571" class="">Even</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">if</st> I <st data-num="0559" class="">thought</st> that <st data-num="03426" class="">there was</st> <st data-num="08615" class="">hope</st> that I could <st data-num="01961" class="">get</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">married</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">tonight</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">conceive</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>,<n id="2" />

surely you would not want to wait until they were old enough to marry. Surely you would not remain unmarried all that time! No, my daughters, you must not return with me. For my intense suffering is too much for you to bear. For the Lord is afflicting me!”
Again they wept loudly. Then Orpah kissed her mother-in-law goodbye, but Ruth clung tightly to her.

So Naomi<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, your <st data-num="02994" class="">sister-in-law</st> is <st data-num="07725" class="">returning</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> her <st data-num="0430" class="">god</st>.<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">Follow</st> your <st data-num="02994" class="">sister-in-law</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">back</st> home!”

But Ruth replied,

“Stop urging me to abandon you!

For wherever you go, I will go.

Wherever you live, I will live.

Your people will become my people,

and your God will become my God.

Wherever you die, I will die—and there I will be buried.

May the Lord punish me severely if I do not keep my promise!

Only death will be able to separate me from you!”
When Naomi realized that Ruth was determined to go with her, she stopped trying to dissuade her.

So the two of them journeyed together until they arrived in Bethlehem.

When they entered Bethlehem, the whole village was excited about their arrival. The women of the village said, “Can this be Naomi?”

But she <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> them,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">call</st> me ‘<st data-num="05281" class="">Naomi</st>’!<n id="3" /> <st data-num="07121" class="">Call</st> me ‘<st data-num="04755" class="">Mara</st>’<n id="4" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> the <st data-num="07706" class="">Sovereign One</st><n id="5" /> has <st data-num="04843" class="">treated</st> me <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="04843" class="">harshly</st>.<n id="6" />
I left here full, but the Lord has caused me to return empty-handed. Why do you call me ‘Naomi,’ seeing that the Lord has opposed me, and the Sovereign One has caused me to suffer?”
So Naomi returned, accompanied by her Moabite daughter-in-law Ruth, who came back with her from the region of Moab. (Now they arrived in Bethlehem at the beginning of the barley harvest.)
